title: Authors and Citation
text: Gardiner S (2024). ozgs: Use Australian Statistical Geography Standard R. R package version 0.0.1.9000, https://gardiners.github.io/ozgs/, https://github.com/gardiners/ozgs.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ozgs: Use the Australian Statistical Geography Standard in R},   author = {Sam Gardiner},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.1.9000, https://gardiners.github.io/ozgs/},   url = {https://github.com/gardiners/ozgs}, }

what: Use the Australian Statistical Geography Standard in R
title: Use the Australian Statistical Geography Standard in R
text: ozgs fetches caches sf geometries data Australian Statistical Geography Standard (ASGS) web service.

title: Use the Australian Statistical Geography Standard in R
text: can install development version ozgs GitHub : r-universe :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("gardiners/ozgs") install.packages('ozgs', repos = c('https://gardiners.r-universe.dev',                                    'https://cloud.r-project.org'))

title: Use the Australian Statistical Geography Standard in R
text: Every geometry published ABS every edition ASGS (1, 2 3) currently available ozgs. include Indigenous Structure, Statistical Areas (SA1, SA2, SA3 SA4), states territories, postcode approximations (POAs), suburbs localities, local government areas (LGAs), state federal electoral divisions, Remoteness Structure mesh blocks constructed. ozgs uses arcgislayersüì¶ easy querying, filtering spatial queries.

title: Use the Australian Statistical Geography Standard in R
text: Requests cached avoid repeatedly fetching large quantities data ABS servers. default, ozgs creates simple memory cache using cachem::cache_mem(), persists current session. persistently store ASGS geometries locally (elsewhere), can use cachem-compatible cache function.

title: Use the Australian Statistical Geography Standard in R
text: Plot Tasmania‚Äôs coastlines, using data 1st edition ASGS:  Fetch every 3rd-edition SA1 intersects Sydney Local Government Area, extent 2023:  Store cached geometries within working directory reuse sessions (especially helpful ‚Äôre working RMarkdown Quarto, start fresh session render): , set ozgs.cache option use everywhere script, effect:
code: library(ozgs) library(ggplot2)  theme_set(theme_void())  tas <- get_geography("STE", edition = 1, where = "STE_NAME = 'Tasmania'")  ggplot(tas) +   geom_sf() sydney_lga <- get_geography("LGA",                             reference_date = 2023,                             where = "LGA_NAME_2023 = 'Sydney'")  sydney_sa1 <- get_geography("SA1",                             edition = 3,                             filter_geom = sydney_lga$geometry) #> ! `filter_geom` cannot be a "MULTIPOLYGON" geometry. #> ‚Ñπ Using `sf::st_union()` and `sf::st_cast()` to create a "POLYGON" for #>   `filter_geom`.  ggplot(sydney_sa1) +   geom_sf() project_cache <- cachem::cache_disk("./readme_cache") aus <- get_geography("AUS", edition = 3, cache = project_cache) options("ozgs.cache" = cachem::cache_disk("./readme_cache"))

title: Australian Drainage Divisions (ADDs) ‚Äî add
text: Fetch ASGS geometries Australian Drainage Divisions (ADDs) geography.

title: Australian Drainage Divisions (ADDs) ‚Äî add
code: add(   identifier = NULL,   edition = NULL,   reference_date = NULL,   layer = c("gen", "full", "point"),   where = NULL,   filter_geom = NULL,   predicate = c("intersects", "contains", "crosses", "overlaps", "touches", "within"),   cache = getOption("ozgs.cache"),   ... )

title: Australian Drainage Divisions (ADDs) ‚Äî add
text: identifier optional character vector named features download specified geography. ASGS geographies, human-friendly names like e.g. "Tasmania" (feature within STE geography), "Sydney" (feature within LGA geography) "2150" (feature within POA geography). specified, identifier takes precedence . neither identifier specified, features specified geography downloaded. edition ASGS edition: 1, 2, 3. reference_date geography's year release. geographies, reference_year optional specifying edition sufficient. However, LGAs, CEDs SEDs, ASGS contains multiple releases per edition. geographies, reference_date must supplied uniquely identify release. layer One : "gen", default. Fetches simplified geometries generalised 0.000025¬∞ 2.5m. "full", full ASGS geometries. Identical ASGS Shapefile Geopackage downloads. "point", point geometries records geography. optional SQL clause filter features returned request. Ignored identifier specified. filter_geom optional sf::sfc single sf geometry filter records returned request. predicate optional spatial predicate specify relation filter_geom geography. One "intersects", "contains", "crosses", "overlaps", "touches", "within". cache cachem-compatible cache. otherwise specified, defaults memory cache. persistently store downloaded ASGS geometries data, supply object created cachem::cache_disk(). ... Additional arguments passed arcgislayers::arc_read().

title: Australian Drainage Divisions (ADDs) ‚Äî add
text: Australian Drainage Divisions (ADDs) ABS Mesh Block approximation drainage divisions provided Australian Hydrological Geospatial Fabric (V3.2.1).  Please note ABS approximated boundaries match official legal administrative boundaries used statistical purposes. information regions can found following publication: Australian Statistical Geography Standard (ASGS) Edition 3 https://www.abs.gov.au/statistics/standards/australian-statistical-geography-standard-asgs-edition-3/jul2021-jun2026

title: Australian Drainage Divisions (ADDs) ‚Äî add

title: Commonwealth Electoral Divisions (CEDs) ‚Äî ced
text: Commonwealth Electoral Divisions (CED) ABS MB approximation Australian Electoral Commission (AEC) federal electoral division boundaries. Australian Electoral Commission electoral division boundary area legally prescribed purpose returning one member House Representatives, Australia's Federal Lower House Parliament. Boundaries based Australian Electoral Commission electoral division boundaries available prior publication. Commonwealth Electoral Divisions may change Australian Electoral Commission revise boundaries. occurs, Commonwealth Electoral Divisions updated annual basis conjunction updates Non ABS Structures. Please note ABS approximated boundaries match official legal administrative boundaries used statistical purposes. information regions can found following publication: Australian Statistical Geography Standard (ASGS) Edition 3 https://www.abs.gov.au/statistics/standards/australian-statistical-geography-standard-asgs-edition-3/jul2021-jun2026

title: Destination Zones (DZNs) ‚Äî dzn
text: Destination Zones co-designed state territory transport authorities. DZNs designed either whole aggregations Mesh Blocks (MB) align Statistical Area Level 2 boundaries. relationship Statistical Area Level 1 boundaries. Destination Zones incorporated part ASGS first time 2021. information regions can found following publication: Australian Statistical Geography Standard (ASGS) Edition 3 https://www.abs.gov.au/statistics/standards/australian-statistical-geography-standard-asgs-edition-3/jul2021-jun2026

what: Get a geography from the ASGS web service ‚Äî get_geography
title: Get a geography from the ASGS web service ‚Äî get_geography
text: get_geography() downloads caches geometries data defined specified ASGS geography, optional filtering using SQL spatial queries.

title: Get a geography from the ASGS web service ‚Äî get_geography
code: get_geography(   geography,   identifier = NULL,   edition = NULL,   reference_date = NULL,   layer = c("gen", "full", "point"),   where = NULL,   filter_geom = NULL,   predicate = c("intersects", "contains", "crosses", "overlaps", "touches", "within"),   cache = getOption("ozgs.cache"),   ... )

title: Get a geography from the ASGS web service ‚Äî get_geography
text: geography name ASGS geography download. Valid choices ADD, AUS, CED, DZN, GCCSA, IARE, ILOC, IREG, LGA, MB, NRMR, POA, RA, S/T, SA1, SA2, SA3, SA4, ..., TR, UCL. identifier optional character vector named features download specified geography. ASGS geographies, human-friendly names like e.g. "Tasmania" (feature within STE geography), "Sydney" (feature within LGA geography) "2150" (feature within POA geography). specified, identifier takes precedence . neither identifier specified, features specified geography downloaded. edition ASGS edition: 1, 2, 3. reference_date geography's year release. geographies, reference_year optional specifying edition sufficient. However, LGAs, CEDs SEDs, ASGS contains multiple releases per edition. geographies, reference_date must supplied uniquely identify release. layer One : "gen", default. Fetches simplified geometries generalised 0.000025¬∞ 2.5m. "full", full ASGS geometries. Identical ASGS Shapefile Geopackage downloads. "point", point geometries records geography. optional SQL clause filter features returned request. Ignored identifier specified. filter_geom optional sf::sfc single sf geometry filter records returned request. predicate optional spatial predicate specify relation filter_geom geography. One "intersects", "contains", "crosses", "overlaps", "touches", "within". cache cachem-compatible cache. otherwise specified, defaults memory cache. persistently store downloaded ASGS geometries data, supply object created cachem::cache_disk(). ... Additional arguments passed arcgislayers::arc_read().

title: Get a geography from the ASGS web service ‚Äî get_geography
text: Returns sf spatial data frame geometry data requested ASGS geography.

title: Indigenous Areas (IAREs) ‚Äî iare
text: Indigenous Areas medium sized geographic areas built whole Indigenous Locations. designed release analysis detailed statistics Aboriginal Torres Strait Islander people. Changes Indigenous Areas determined consultation Centre Aboriginal Torres Strait Islander Statistics based statistical community requirements. Whole Indigenous Areas aggregate form Indigenous Regions. information regions can found following publication: Australian Statistical Geography Standard (ASGS) Edition 3 https://www.abs.gov.au/statistics/standards/australian-statistical-geography-standard-asgs-edition-3/jul2021-jun2026

title: Indigenous Locations (ILOCs) ‚Äî iloc
text: Indigenous Locations (ILOCs) geographic areas built whole Statistical Areas Level 1 (SA1s). Indigenous Locations designed represent Aboriginal Torres Strait Islander communities minimum population 90 people. Changes Indigenous Locations determined consultation Centre Aboriginal Torres Strait Islander Statistics based statistical community requirements. Whole Indigenous Locations aggregate form Indigenous Areas (IAREs). information regions can found following publication: Australian Statistical Geography Standard (ASGS) Edition 3 https://www.abs.gov.au/statistics/standards/australian-statistical-geography-standard-asgs-edition-3/jul2021-jun2026

title: Local Government Areas (LGAs) ‚Äî lga
text: Local Government Areas (LGAs) ABS Mesh Block representation gazetted local government boundaries defined state territory. Please note ABS approximated boundaries match official legal administrative boundaries used statistical purposes. Officially gazetted Local Government Areas change regularly. ABS updates approximated Local Government Areas annually. information regions can found following publication: Australian Statistical Geography Standard (ASGS) Edition 3 https://www.abs.gov.au/statistics/standards/australian-statistical-geography-standard-asgs-edition-3/jul2021-jun2026

title: National Resource Management Regions (NRMRs) ‚Äî nrmr
text: identifier optional character vector named features download specified geography. ASGS geographies, human-friendly names like e.g. "Tasmania" (feature within STE geography), "Sydney" (feature within LGA geography) "2150" (feature within POA geography). specified, identifier takes precedence . neither identifier specified, features specified geography downloaded. edition ASGS edition: 1, 2, 3. reference_date geography's year release. geographies, reference_year optional specifying edition sufficient. However, LGAs, CEDs SEDs, ASGS contains multiple releases per edition. geographies, reference_date must supplied uniquely identify release. layer One : "gen", default. Fetches simplified geometries generalised 0.000025¬∞ 2.5m. "full", full ASGS geometries. Identical ASGS Shapefile Geopackage downloads. "point", point geometries records geography. optional SQL clause filter features returned request. Ignored identifier specified. filter_geom optional sf::sfc single sf geometry filter records returned request. predicate optional spatial predicate specify relation filter_geom geography. One "intersects", "contains", "crosses", "overlaps", "touches", "within". cache cachem-compatible cache. otherwise specified, defaults memory cache. persistently store downloaded ASGS geometries data, supply object created cachem::cache_disk(). ... Additional arguments passed arcgislayers::arc_read().

title: National Resource Management Regions (NRMRs) ‚Äî nrmr
text: Natural Resource Management Regions (NRMRs) ABS approximation Natural Resource Management regions (NRM). administrative regions primarily used Department Environment Energy Department Agriculture Water Resources share responsibility delivery Australian Government's environment sustainable agriculture programs, broadly referred Natural Resource Management (NRM). information regions can found following publication: Australian Statistical Geography Standard (ASGS): Volume 3 - Non ABS Structure, July 2016 (cat . 1270.0.55.003). http://www.abs.gov.au/ausstats/abs@.nsf/mf/1270.0.55.003

title: Postal Areas (POAs) ‚Äî poa
text: Postal Areas (POAs) ABS Mesh Block approximation general definition postcodes. postcode four digit number used Australia Post assist mail delivery. Postcodes cover , , Australia whereas Postal Areas cover whole geographic Australia. Please note ABS approximated boundaries match official legal administrative boundaries used statistical purposes. information regions can found following publication: Australian Statistical Geography Standard (ASGS) Edition 3 https://www.abs.gov.au/statistics/standards/australian-statistical-geography-standard-asgs-edition-3/jul2021-jun2026

title: Remoteness Areas (RAs) ‚Äî ra
text: Remoteness Areas divide Australia 5 classes remoteness basis relative access services purpose releasing analysing statistical data. Access services measured using Accessibility Remoteness Index Australia (ARIA+), provided Hugo Centre Migration Population Research University Adelaide. Remoteness Areas aggregates Statistical Areas Level 1 (SA1s) grouped together based average ARIA+ score. areas redefined every five years data Census Population Housing well survey data released Remoteness Areas.

title: State Electoral Divisions (SEDs) ‚Äî sed
text: State Electoral Divisions (SED) ABS Mesh Block approximation state electoral districts. state electoral district area legally prescribed purpose returning one members State Territory Lower Houses Parliament, relevant equivalent. Boundaries based date state electoral districts available prior publication. State Electoral Divisions may change State Territory authorities revise boundaries. occurs, State Electoral Divisions updated annual basis conjunction updates Non ABS Structures. Please note ABS approximated boundaries match official legal administrative boundaries used statistical purposes. information regions can found following publication: Australian Statistical Geography Standard (ASGS) Edition 3 https://www.abs.gov.au/statistics/standards/australian-statistical-geography-standard-asgs-edition-3/jul2021-jun2026

title: Significant Urban Areas (SUAs) ‚Äî sua
text: identifier optional character vector named features download specified geography. ASGS geographies, human-friendly names like e.g. "Tasmania" (feature within STE geography), "Sydney" (feature within LGA geography) "2150" (feature within POA geography). specified, identifier takes precedence . neither identifier specified, features specified geography downloaded. edition ASGS edition: 1, 2, 3. reference_date geography's year release. geographies, reference_year optional specifying edition sufficient. However, LGAs, CEDs SEDs, ASGS contains multiple releases per edition. geographies, reference_date must supplied uniquely identify release. layer One : "gen", default. Fetches simplified geometries generalised 0.000025¬∞ 2.5m. "full", full ASGS geometries. Identical ASGS Shapefile Geopackage downloads. "point", point geometries records geography. optional SQL clause filter features returned request. Ignored identifier specified. filter_geom optional sf::sfc single sf geometry filter records returned request. predicate optional spatial predicate specify relation filter_geom geography. One "intersects", "contains", "crosses", "overlaps", "touches", "within". cache cachem-compatible cache. otherwise specified, defaults memory cache. persistently store downloaded ASGS geometries data, supply object created cachem::cache_disk(). ... Additional arguments passed arcgislayers::arc_read().

title: Tourism Regions (TRs) ‚Äî tr
text: Tourism Regions (TRs) ABS SA2 approximation tourism regions provided Tourism Research Australia. administrative regions primarily used Tourism Research Australia research policy purposes. Please note ABS approximated boundaries match official legal administrative boundaries used statistical purposes. information regions can found following publication: Australian Statistical Geography Standard (ASGS) Edition 3 https://www.abs.gov.au/statistics/standards/australian-statistical-geography-standard-asgs-edition-3/jul2021-jun2026
